title: One or Both Optic Discs are Swollen
author: Tariq Mohammad
keyPoints: Ensure baseline fundus photographs/OCT disc are taken on first presentation if available
Do not confuse a crowded disc, optic disc drusen and tilted discs with true optic disc swelling
Positive spontaneous venous pulsation does not completely rule out true disc swelling
GCA is a clinical diagnosis and a normal ESR and/or CRP doesn't rule out GCA

q1.text: Is the disc swelling unilateral or bilateral?

q2.text: What is the patient's age and any systemic symptoms?

q3.text: Is there a relative afferent pupillary defect (RAPD)?

q4.text: Any visual field defects or reduced visual acuity?

q5.text: Any headache, nausea, or neurological symptoms?

q6.text: What is the blood pressure and any papilloedema features?

q7.text: Are there spontaneous venous pulsations visible?

gca_risk.text: HIGH GCA RISK: Urgent ESR, CRP, FBC. If ESR >50 or high clinical suspicion, start prednisolone 80mg immediately. Urgent temporal artery biopsy within 7 days. Same-day ophthalmology referral.

optic_neuritis.text: OPTIC NEURITIS: MRI brain and orbits with gadolinium. Consider demyelinating disease workup. Urgent neurology referral. May need IV methylprednisolone if severe.

early_optic_neuropathy.text: EARLY OPTIC NEUROPATHY: Close monitoring required. Repeat visual fields in 1-2 weeks. Consider MRI if progressive. Ophthalmology follow-up.

pseudopapilloedema_check.text: POSSIBLE PSEUDOPAPILLOEDEMA: OCT optic disc to differentiate from true swelling. Look for optic disc drusen. Ophthalmology referral for assessment.

malignant_hypertension.text: MALIGNANT HYPERTENSION: Urgent BP control (target 10-15% reduction in first hour). Check for end-organ damage. Urgent medical referral. Monitor for visual changes.

raised_icp.text: RAISED INTRACRANIAL PRESSURE: Urgent CT/MRI brain. Check for space-occupying lesion, hydrocephalus. Urgent neurology/neurosurgery referral. Consider lumbar puncture if imaging normal.

imaging_required.text: IMAGING REQUIRED: CT/MRI brain to exclude mass lesion. OCT optic disc for objective measurement. Urgent ophthalmology and neurology referral.

pseudopapilloedema_likely.text: PSEUDOPAPILLOEDEMA LIKELY: OCT optic disc and B-scan to look for drusen. If confirmed pseudopapilloedema, routine ophthalmology follow-up. Reassure patient.

true_swelling_likely.text: TRUE PAPILLOEDEMA: Urgent neuroimaging and lumbar puncture if imaging normal. Check opening pressure. Urgent neurology referral for raised ICP workup.
